title: SWB Rural Law Enforcement Assistance Program Awards

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: SWB Rural Law Enforcement Assistance Program Awards
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to the BJA website, has "allocated a total of $3,347,403.62 to 53 agencies (52 small, rural, and tribal agencies and one law enforcement coalition)" as part of the Southwest Border Rural Law Enforcement Assistance Program (https://ncirc.bja.ojp.gov/southwest-border). I am seeking a list of these awards, including the recipient agency, amount, and equipment purchased for each award. If this exists as a spreadsheet this would suffice. If not, please provide the records for each individual assistance award. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dave Maass
Director of Investigations
Electronic Frontier Foundation

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

On 1/28/2025 between 1:28pm and 5:35 at least 11 ALPR queries were run by Palos Heights Police Department relating to immigration violations, looking for vehicle license plates in both Illinois and nationally across the United States. The queries include the following plates: "3376532B" "ES53782" and "CF49166". 

Please provide the following documents relating to these queries:
1) Police reports, investigative files, and case notes for the cases involving these queries. 
2) Any policies, procedures, SOPs, or internal memos from Palos Heights PD regarding working on immigration cases and cooperation with ICE. 
3) If the query was run as part of a taskforce assignment, please provide any post orders or other designations (letter of assignment, email stating they are assigned to that taskforce, etc.) that indicate the individual was assigned to the taskforce at that time.    

Thank you in advance for your time and response to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Abe Segal
